news_header: At least 10 people have died due to a volcanic eruption in eastern Indonesia.
news_text: A volcanic eruption at Mount Lewotobi Laki-laki on Flores Island in eastern Indonesia has resulted in at least 10 fatalities. The eruption occurred at 23:57 local time and affected seven villages, with lava and rocks damaging homes. The Indonesian Center for Volcanology has raised the alert level and initiated evacuations for residents within a 7km radius. Eyewitness accounts depict scenes of destruction, and local authorities have declared a state of emergency for 58 days to facilitate aid for the affected population.
